verses.verse: Boast <S%H1984><s%> not thyself of <S%H4279>to-morrow<s%>; For thou <S%H3045>knowest<s%> not what a <S%H4279>day<s%> may bring <S%H3205>forth<s%>.
Let another <S%H2114>man<s%> <S%H1984>praise<s%> <S%H6310>thee<s%>, and not thine own mouth; A <S%H5237>stranger<s%>, and not thine own <S%H8193>lips<s%>.
A <S%H68>stone<s%> is <S%H3514>heavy<s%>, and the <S%H2344>sand<s%> <S%H5192>weighty<s%>; But a <S%H191>fool<s%>'s <S%H3708>vexation<s%> is <S%H3515>heavier<s%> than they <S%H8147>both<s%>.
Wrath <S%H2534><s%> is <S%H395>cruel<s%>, and <S%H639>anger<s%> is <S%H7858>overwhelming<s%>; But who is able to <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H7068>jealousy<s%>?
Better <S%H2896><s%> is <S%H1540>open<s%> <S%H8433>rebuke<s%> Than <S%H160>love<s%> that is <S%H5641>hidden<s%>.
Faithful <S%H539><s%> are the <S%H6482>wounds<s%> of a <S%H157>friend<s%>; But the <S%H5390>kisses<s%> of an <S%H8130>enemy<s%> are <S%H6280>profuse<s%>.
The <S%H7649>full<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H947>loatheth<s%> a <S%H5317>honeycomb<s%>; But to the <S%H7457>hungry<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> every bitter <S%H4751>thing<s%> is <S%H4966>sweet<s%>.
As a <S%H6833>bird<s%> that <S%H5074>wandereth<s%> from her <S%H7064>nest<s%>, So is a <S%H376>man<s%> that <S%H5074>wandereth<s%> from his <S%H4725>place<s%>.

Oil <S%H8081><s%> and <S%H7004>perfume<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> the <S%H3820>heart<s%>; So doth the <S%H4986>sweetness<s%> of a <S%H7453>man<s%>'s friend that cometh of <S%H5315>hearty<s%> <S%H6098>counsel<s%>.

Thine own <S%H7453>friend<s%>, and thy <S%H1>father<s%>'s <S%H7453>friend<s%>, <S%H5800>forsake<s%> <S%H935>not<s%>; And go not to thy <S%H251>brother<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of thy <S%H343>calamity<s%>: <S%H2896>Better<s%> is a <S%H7934>neighbor<s%> that is <S%H7138>near<s%> than a <S%H251>brother<s%> far <S%H7350>off<s%>.
My <S%H1121>son<s%>, be <S%H2449>wise<s%>, and make my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H8055>glad<s%>, That I may <S%H7725>answer<s%> him that reproacheth <S%H2778>me<s%>.
A <S%H6175>prudent<s%> man <S%H7200>seeth<s%> the <S%H7451>evil<s%>, and <S%H5641>hideth<s%> <S%H6612>himself<s%>; But the simple pass <S%H5674>on<s%>, and suffer for <S%H6064>it<s%>.
Take <S%H3947><s%> his <S%H899>garment<s%> that is <S%H6148>surety<s%> for a <S%H2114>stranger<s%>; And hold him in <S%H2254>pledge<s%> that is surety for a foreign <S%H5237>woman<s%>.

He that <S%H1288>blesseth<s%> his <S%H7453>friend<s%> with a <S%H1419>loud<s%> <S%H6963>voice<s%>, rising <S%H7925>early<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning<s%>, It shall be <S%H2803>counted<s%> a curse to <S%H7045>him<s%>.
A <S%H2956>continual<s%> <S%H1812>dropping<s%> in a very <S%H5464>rainy<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%> And a <S%H4079>contentious<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%> are <S%H7737>alike<s%>:
He that would <S%H6845>restrain<s%> her <S%H6845>restraineth<s%> the <S%H7307>wind<s%>; And his right <S%H3225>hand<s%> <S%H7121>encountereth<s%> <S%H8081>oil<s%>.
Iron <S%H1270><s%> <S%H2300>sharpeneth<s%> <S%H1270>iron<s%>; So a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2300>sharpeneth<s%> the <S%H6440>countenance<s%> of his <S%H7453>friend<s%>.
Whoso <S%H5341>keepeth<s%> the <S%H8384>fig-tree<s%> shall <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> <S%H8104>thereof<s%>; And he that regardeth his <S%H113>master<s%> shall be <S%H3513>honored<s%>.
As in <S%H4325>water<s%> <S%H6440>face<s%> answereth to <S%H6440>face<s%>, So the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> to <S%H120>man<s%>.
Sheol <S%H7585><s%> and <S%H11>Abaddon<s%> are <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H7646>satisfied<s%>; And the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> are never <S%H7646>satisfied<s%>.
The refining <S%H4715>pot<s%> is for <S%H3701>silver<s%>, and the <S%H3564>furnace<s%> for <S%H2091>gold<s%>; And a <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H6310>tried<s%> by his <S%H4110>praise<s%>.

Though thou shouldest <S%H3806>bray<s%> a <S%H191>fool<s%> in a <S%H4388>mortar<s%> <S%H8432>with<s%> a <S%H5940>pestle<s%> along with bruised <S%H7383>grain<s%>, Yet will not his <S%H200>foolishness<s%> depart from <S%H5493>him<s%>.
Be thou <S%H3045>diligent<s%> to <S%H3045>know<s%> the <S%H6440>state<s%> of thy <S%H6629>flocks<s%>, And <S%H7896>look<s%> <S%H3820>well<s%> to thy <S%H5739>herds<s%>:
For <S%H2633>riches<s%> are not for <S%H5769>ever<s%>: And doth the <S%H5145>crown<s%> endure unto <S%H1755>all<s%> <S%H1755>generations<s%>?
The <S%H2682>hay<s%> is <S%H1540>carried<s%>, and the tender <S%H1877>grass<s%> <S%H7200>showeth<s%> <S%H6212>itself<s%>, And the herbs of the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> are gathered <S%H622>in<s%>.
The <S%H3532>lambs<s%> are for thy <S%H3830>clothing<s%>, And the <S%H6260>goats<s%> are the <S%H4242>price<s%> of the <S%H7704>field<s%>;

And there will be <S%H5795>goats<s%>' <S%H2461>milk<s%> <S%H1767>enough<s%> for thy <S%H3899>food<s%>, for the <S%H3899>food<s%> of thy <S%H1004>household<s%>, And <S%H2416>maintenance<s%> for thy <S%H5291>maidens<s%>.
